items.title: TrucksUp appoints Abhijay Ratan as CMO
items.summary:
- *TrucksUp*, a Gurugram-based logistics aggregator, has appointed **Abhijay Ratan** as its new **Chief Marketing Officer**.
- Ratan brings over two decades of experience in *sales, marketing*, and *growth strategy*, with prior roles at Blackbuck.
- His focus will be on enhancing the company's branding, digital visibility, and industry partnerships to position TrucksUp as a **technology-driven platform** in trucking and logistics.

items.title: US Q2 GDP Revised Higher on AI Investment
items.summary:
- *US GDP for Q2* was revised upwards to a 3.3% annual rate, driven by increased *business investment* in *intellectual property* like *AI*. 
- *Consumer spending* also grew faster, but _tariffs_ on imports continue to cloud the economy's outlook, with some experts expecting a slowdown. 
- Despite profit rebounds and strong demand, *labor market* conditions remain soft, influencing potential _interest rate_ decisions by the Federal Reserve.

items.title: Samvardhana Motherson to acquire 81% stake in Yutaka Giken
items.summary: *Samvardhana Motherson* will acquire an **81% stake** in Japanâ€™s *Yutaka Giken* for **$184 million**. This strategically expands Motherson's partnership with Honda and strengthens its presence in *automotive components*. The deal involves acquiring *Yutaka Giken*'s subsidiary and full ownership of *Yutaka Autoparts India*, boosting global supply chain and market reach, with the transaction expected to complete by Q1 FY27. *Yutaka Giken* operates internationally, with FY25 sales of JPY 179 billion ($1.2 billion).

items.title: Covestro completes acquisition of Pontacol
items.summary:
*Covestro*, a global polymer materials supplier, has *acquired* Swiss producer *Pontacol* for multilayer *adhesive films*.
- The acquisition, effective August 28, 2025, adds specialized films supporting growth in *medical technology*, *mobility*, and *textiles* sectors.
- The deal includes two manufacturing sites and aims to strengthen Covestro's global network and product portfolio, with no disclosed purchase price.

**Scores:** {"scale": 7, "impact": 6, "novelty": 5, "longTermSignificance": 7}

items.title: Deal for E10 Shinkansen bullet train: Why Japan is eyeing India for its fastest train
IIM Calcutta launches programme on smart manufacturing leadership
Delhi invests â‚¹170 crore to upgrade ITIs with new tech skills
items.summary:
*The Delhi government will spend â‚¹170 crore to modernise 15 ITIs, focusing on emerging technologies such as *artificial intelligence*, *robotics*, *electric mobility*, and *green energy*.*
- *Selected institutes will serve as hubs, guiding nearby campuses in curriculum updates, infrastructure, and industry linkages, including courses on AI, robotics, and EV maintenance.*
- *The initiative aims to equip youth with 21st-century skills through advanced training, Smart classrooms, industry collaborations, and setting up specialized Centers of Excellence.*

items.title: Adani Power's 2,400 MW Thermal Plant in Bihar
items.summary:
- *Adani Power* has received a **LoA** to develop a **2,400 MW** greenfield *thermal power plant* in Bihar with a **USD 3 billion** investment.
- The project, aimed at supplying power to Bihar, will generate *employment* for up to 12,000 people during construction and 3,000 in operation.
- This initiative aligns with Indiaâ€™s goal to expand *thermal capacity* and meet the growing *power demand* of the country, which is projected to reach over 700 GW by 2047.

items.title: Semiconductors are â€˜new steelâ€™ for Indiaâ€™s eco-tech security
items.summary:
- *Vellayan Subbiah* compares *semiconductors* to 'new steel', emphasizing their role in *Indiaâ€™s economic & tech security*.  
- *CG Power* is investing in *domestic semiconductor manufacturing* and acquiring *IP-focused fabless design companies* like Axiro Semiconductor.  
- Owning *Intellectual Property (IP)* is crucial for *India* to participate profitably in the *semiconductor* value chain and ensure *technological autonomy*.

items.title: India and Saudi Arabia explore joint defence manufacturing
items.summary:
- *India and Saudi Arabia* are considering **collaborative defence manufacturing** to strengthen their strategic partnership.
- Discussions in New Delhi focused on **training, maritime cooperation, and joint military exercises**, with an emphasis on developing **defence technologies**.
- The move aims to shift from simple buyer-seller relations to **joint development and production** of military equipment, deepening **bilateral military ties**.

items.title: Mobile phone companies push for tax relief to drive up sales
Meenakshi Energyâ€™s 1,000 MW Power Plant Fully Operational
items.summary:
*Meenakshi Energy*, a Vedanta Ltd subsidiary, has completed its **1000 MW thermal power plant** in Andhra Pradesh, now fully operational with four units. 
- The facility plays a crucial role in Indiaâ€™s *energy security*, contributing over 70% of the country's electricity. 
- The plant uses 100% saline water and has implemented water recovery systems, highlighting sustainability efforts.

items.title: Digitalisation, automation boost mining efficiency
items.summary:
- Indian mining and metals firms can achieve **10-15% efficiency gains** through *digitalisation and automation*, saving cost and time.
- Technologies like **AI, IoT, robotics**, and advanced data analytics are key drivers, while workforce upskilling is crucial.
- The report highlights the potential for productivity improvements to help meet rising demand for critical minerals amid environmental and resource challenges, supporting sustainable growth by 2030.

items.title: Tata Steel announces â‚¹303.13 crore bonus for FY'25
items.summary:
*Tata Steel will payout a total of â‚¹303.13 crore as *bonus* for FY'25, following a settlement with the *union* in Jamshedpur.*
- The bonus will be distributed among 11,446 employees, with amounts ranging from â‚¹39,004 to â‚¹3,92,213.
- The company emphasizes tradition by paying bonuses to all unionized employees, despite some earning above the statutory limit for bonus eligibility.*

items.title: Google has cut 35% of managers overseeing small teams: Executive
CapitaLand to sell Chennai leased unit to Pegatron
items.summary:
*CapitaLand is planning to sell an industrial property in Chennai leased to Pegatron, a major Apple supplier.*
- The 750,000 sq ft facility, integral to iPhone manufacturing, is valued at around â‚¹600 crore, with bidders like Brookfield, Hines, and Hillhouse Capital interested.
- This sale highlights Indiaâ€™s growing role in Appleâ€™s global supply chain and the recent expansion of iPhone production in the country.

*Keywords: CapitalLand, Pegatron, Apple, India, iPhone manufacturing, industrial real estate*

items.title: India's semiconductor mission covers all major sectors, including drone chip manufacturing
items.summary:
*India's Semiconductor Mission* aims to develop a *robust semiconductor ecosystem* across sectors like automotive, telecom, and electronics.
*All major areas, including drone chip manufacturing*, are now covered under this initiative, with new facilities set up.
The government emphasizes *self-reliance* and *global collaboration* to strengthen India's position in electronics manufacturing.*

items.title: Samsung's Transition to 'AI Phone' Era
items.summary:
- *Samsung* is shifting from traditional smartphones to the **'AI Phone'** era, emphasizing *artificial intelligence* as the new user interface.
- Features like **real-time translation** and personalized AI interactions are being integrated through the **Galaxy AI platform**.
- The transition will involve significant **platform evolution** and **technology innovation**, especially in **battery management and AI optimization** for devices like the Galaxy Fold series.

items.title: Uno Minda's Growth Despite Limited US Components
items.summary:
* Uno Minda's shares hit a record high of â‚¹1,301, fueled by strong June quarter results and growth prospects. 
* The company benefits from limited exposure to US tariffs, with manufacturing in multiple countries, shielding it from US trade issues. 
* Strategic management changes, future capex plans, and acquisitions in EV systems position Uno Minda for sustained growth.

items.title: Nippon Steel plans $11B US expansion after acquisition
items.summary:
*Nippon Steel will invest $11 billion in US Steel by 2028 to expand capacity and develop new products.*
- The plan includes capacity increases from 17 to 20 million tonnes and technology transfer.
- Expected profits aim to reach 250 billion yen (~$1.7 billion) by 2028, with several large-scale projects underway.

**Key initiatives:** hot-rolling mill, furnace refurbishment, new steel lines, and potential greenfield mill.**
- The investment enhances US Steel's domestic capacity and Nippon Steelâ€™s global capacity to 86 million tonnes.
- US Steel will initially fund the investment, with Nippon Steel providing additional support if needed.
- The plan follows Nippon Steelâ€™s $14.9 billion acquisition of US Steel, finalized in June 2025.

items.title: GLP secures $1.5B investment from ADIA unit
items.summary:
- *GLP*, a global logistics developer, has secured up to **$1.5 billion** from an ADIA subsidiary to fund growth.
- The investment will boost GLP's presence in **logistics**, **digital infrastructure**, and **renewable energy** sectors.
- ADIA's involvement marks its first direct *shareholding* in GLP, highlighting increased interest in data centers and infrastructure investments amid rising demand for AI and digital services.

items.title: Semiconductors are new steel for Indiaâ€™s eco-tech security
items.summary: *Vellayan Subbiah emphasizes that semiconductors are the 'new steel'* essential for India's economic and technological security, paralleling JRD Tataâ€™s steel pioneering. *CG Power is focusing on building IP ownership* through acquisitions like Axiro Semiconductor to gain control over core chip designs. *The company advocates for developing a complete semiconductor ecosystem* in India, including supplier clustering and domestic advanced packaging to enhance global competitiveness.

items.title: India's tablet market declines 32.3% in 2025 first half
items.summary:
- *India's tablet shipments decreased by 32.3%* to 2.15 million units in early 2025, mainly due to reduced government-funded programs.
- *Samsung maintained its leading position* with a 41.3% market share, driven by public sector projects and online retail strategies.
- *The market experienced a sharper decline* in slate tablets (44.4%) while detachable tablets grew by 18.9%, indicating shifts in consumer and commercial segments.

items.title: FM commits support for exporters amid US tariffs
items.summary:
*Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman assures comprehensive support to Indian exporters* to sustain growth, especially after a 50% US tariff impact on about 55% of exports. 

*She emphasized protecting workers' livelihoods* and called on industry leaders to reassure employees despite global challenges. 

*Ongoing diplomatic efforts* continue to resolve tariff disputes, with India and the US maintaining communication channels to safeguard trade interests and employment.

items.title: First Made in India semiconductor chip to roll out soon from Sanand's CG plant: Ashwini Vaishnaw
India launches semiconductor OSAT pilot line in Gujarat
boAt partners with startup HrdWyr for indigenously designed semiconductor chip
items.summary:
- *boAt* collaborates with *HrdWyr*, an Indian startup, to develop the **Indus 1011**, a *indigenously designed high-volume semiconductor chip*. 
- The chip will be used in boAt's upcoming premium *TWS charging cases* next year, emphasizing *Made in India* innovation. 
- The partnership supports India's *semiconductor mission*, *Make in India*, and *Atmanirbhar Bharat* initiatives, showcasing Indiaâ€™s growing capabilities in *semiconductor design* and *localisation*.

items.title: Aimtron to produce 50,000 IIoT & AI devices for Vanix
items.summary:
*Aimtron Electronics* will manufacture 50,000 *IIoT* and *AI devices* for Vanix Technologies under a December 2024 MoU.

- The first batch is scheduled for production in October 2025, supporting Indiaâ€™s *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat* initiatives.
- This project aims to bolster Indiaâ€™s *electronics manufacturing* sector, with potential to produce up to 2 million devices over five years.

**Keywords:** IIoT, AI, electronics manufacturing, Make in India, Atmanirbhar Bharat, industrial IoT market

items.title: Godrej Enterprises Group launches IoT-based forklift monitoring system
Wired for performance in renewable O&M
items.summary:
- *Digital-led O&M* transformation is vital for enhancing *asset performance* in renewable energy.
- Inefficient practices and data underutilization result in *financial losses* and *lower IRR*.
- Implementing *predictive analytics* and *digital tools* can streamline operations, reduce disruptions, and foster *long-term resilience*.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc and Epiroc collaborate on digital safety
items.summary:
- *Hindustan Zinc* signed an agreement with Sweden's *Epiroc* to deploy *Collision Avoidance Systems* in its underground mines.
- The system, first installed at the Sindesar Khurd Mine, uses sensors, alerts, and wearable tags to prevent collisions, enhancing *safety* and operational efficiency.
- The rollout will happen in phases, starting with 30 trucks, aiming to improve *mining safety* and support *digital transformation* in operations.

items.title: ADI adopts NVIDIA Jetson Thor for humanoid and robotics development
items.summary:
- *Analog Devices* (ADI) has integrated *NVIDIAâ€™s Jetson Thor* platform to advance *humanoid robots* and *autonomous mobile robots (AMRs)*.
- The platform combines ADIâ€™s *edge sensing*, *precision motion control*, and *power management* with NVIDIA's cutting-edge *compute capabilities* to support *simulation to deployment* scaling.
- ADI aims to enable *reasoning-enabled robots*, closing the *simulation-to-reality gap* with *robotics foundation models* and *physically accurate simulation* in Isaac Sim for smoother real-world deployment.

items.title: India's Industrial Production Grows 3.5% in July
items.summary:
- *Indiaâ€™s Index of Industrial Production (IIP)* increased by **3.5%** in July 2025, up from 1.5% in June.
- The *manufacturing sector* led the growth with a **5.4%** expansion, while *mining* contracted by **7.2%**.
- *Key contributors* included *basic metals*, *electrical equipment*, and *non-metallic mineral products*, driving overall industrial growth.

*Impacted sectors* varied, with some industries shrinking and others expanding, reflecting a *diverse industrial landscape*.

items.title: Ashok Leylandâ€™s Digital Factory Revolution
items.summary: *Ashok Leyland has transformed its manufacturing with a *digital nervous system* that uses AI and IoT for real-time decision-making.*  The factory now operates quietly with sensors, cameras, and AI-driven processes that detect and correct issues instantly.*  This shift from traditional automation to a *comprehensive, data-driven orchestration* enhances quality, efficiency, and predictive maintenance across the enterprise.

items.title: Garment hubs of Gurgaon & Noida face uncertain times
items.summary:
- The *Indian garment industry* is experiencing significant disruption due to *US tariffs*, impacting exports and employment. 
- Major hubs like *Gurgaon* and *Noida* supply brands such as Target and Zara, but face challenges from increased costs and *potential closures*. 
- Industry insiders warn that without government support, ongoing *cost pressures* could lead to *job losses* and a prolonged economic strain on the sector, which contributes 2.3% to India's GDP.

items.title: Mahindra Aerostructures wins Airbus fuselage contract
items.summary:
*Mahindra Aerostructures* secured a contract to manufacture the **fuselage** of Airbus H125 helicopters, with production starting in Bengaluru and first delivery expected in 2027.
- The contract highlights Indiaâ€™s growing role in *global aerospace manufacturing* and reinforces the **Make in India** initiative.
- Airbus values their partnership with Mahindra, which already supplies components for multiple programs, emphasizing India as a **key aerospace hub**.

items.title: Nvidia still growing, but China uncertainty clouds outlook
Nvidia CEO foresees AI boom extending to trillions
items.summary:
*Jensen Huang, Nvidia's CEO, predicts AI infrastructure spending could reach $3â€“4 trillion by 2030.*
- Despite signs of a slowdown, Huang remains optimistic, citing high demand for Nvidia's chips, especially Blackwell and Hopper models.*
- The AI boom is driven by major tech companies like Microsoft and Amazon investing heavily in data centers, with Nvidia benefiting from this capital expenditure.*

items.title: Need to build surge capacity for long wars, says Rajnath Singh
items.summary:
*Defence minister Rajnath Singh emphasizes the importance of *surge capacity* for India to prepare for unpredictable, long-term wars.*
- He highlights the need for *self-reliance* through technological advancement and streamlined defense industry practices.*
- Singh stresses that future warfare will rely heavily on *technology, intelligence,* and *adaptability*, urging India to become a leading *indigenous defense exporter*.

items.title: A thinner slice of GST = Larger FMCG helpings
items.summary:
- FMCG companies plan to **restore grammage** in â‚¹5 and â‚¹10 packs as new **GST reforms** make price cuts difficult.
- Firms will increase pack weight rather than reduce prices, reversing recent shrinkflation trends amid rising raw material costs.
- Expected GST cuts could **boost demand**, especially for snack, biscuit, and packaged food categories, benefiting major players like Nestle, ITC, and HUL.

items.title: Government extends cotton import duty exemption till Dec 31
items.summary:
*The Indian government extended the import duty exemption on raw cotton until December 31, 2025,* aiming to support the domestic textile industry amid high input costs.
- *Shares of textile firms like Vardhman Textiles and Gokaldas Exports fell* following the announcement, reflecting market reactions.
- *This move occurs amidst international trade tensions,* including increased tariffs from the U.S., impacting Indian exports and market dynamics.

items.title: Sustainable and secure semiconductor manufacturing: A strategic imperative for India
items.summary: *India has a strategic opportunity to lead in *sustainable* and *secure* semiconductor manufacturing.* The countryâ€™s focus includes embedding *renewable energy, waste management,* and *industrial security* into fab ecosystems.* Ensuring the resilience of these critical facilities is vital for *economic* and *national security* in a geopolitically turbulent era.

items.title: Acme Solar plans â‚¹3,000 cr fundraise in multiple tranches
items.summary:
- *Acme Solar Holdings* approved a proposal to raise â‚¹3,000 crore through multiple methods, including **equity shares** and **debt instruments**.
- The funds are intended for expansion, pending approval at the upcoming AGM on September 29, 2025.
- The company, diversified across **solar, wind**, and **renewable energy projects**, aims to strengthen its position in Indiaâ€™s energy sector.

items.title: Steelmakers seek near-sevenfold rise in met coke import quota amid supply crunch
items.summary:
- *Indian steel producers* are requesting a **sevenfold increase** in *met coke import quotas* to address a **severe supply shortage**.
- The government has maintained strict *import caps*, but companies like JSW Steel and ArcelorMittal are urging for higher allocations, especially from *Indonesia*, *Japan*, and *Poland*.
- The *domestic output* of met coke is deemed insufficient, prompting appeals for more imports to sustain *steel production* expansion plans.

items.title: Hindalco Builds iPhone Chassis Unit in Andhra
items.summary:
*Hindalco Industries* plans to invest â‚¹586 crore in Andhra Pradesh to establish an *aluminium extrusion facility* in Kuppam, primarily for mobile phone chassis production for Appleâ€™s iPhones.
- The new plant aims for commercial launch by March 2027 and is expected to create 613 jobs, boosting Andhra Pradesh into the *iPhone supply chain*.
- This initiative benefits from Andhra Pradeshâ€™s strategic location near Bengaluru and Chennai, and will be supported by the *AP Electronics Component Manufacturing Policy 2025-30*, including incentives and subsidised land.

items.title: Why Intelâ€™s problems canâ€™t be fixed by the US government
items.summary:
- *Intel* faces serious issues due to poor decisions, lagging behind competitors in *semiconductors* and *AI*.
- The US governmentâ€™s recent move to take a **10% stake** risks politicizing decision-making, potentially harming *innovation* and *competitiveness*.
- Instead of bailouts, Congress should focus on reforms like expanding skilled immigration, reducing tariffs, and boosting *R&D* to strengthen US chip manufacturing.

items.title: DN Solutions to acquire HELLER, expand global machine tool portfolio
items.summary:
- *DN Solutions* plans to acquire *HELLER*, a historic German machine tool company, to **expand its global presence**.  
- The merger will **combine expertise** in machining centers and broaden offerings in *complex machining* and *5-axis technologies*.  
- This strategic move aims to **strengthen market position**, offering customers a **comprehensive portfolio** from a single provider, pending regulatory approvals.

items.title: Khetika opens new manufacturing unit in Bengaluru; aims for 50% market share
items.summary:
*Khetika has launched a new Bengaluru manufacturing facility dedicated to fresh, preservative-free products.*
- The 5,000 sq. ft. unit uses modern automation and traditional techniques to maintain quality and nutrition.
- The brand aims to capture **50%** of Bengaluru's fresh product market within a year and expand across India with multiple new units.*

items.title: Aqualab Surpasses â‚¹100 Crore, Aims for â‚¹250 Crore by FY 25â€“26
items.summary:
- *Aqualab*, the direct-to-retail division of *Laborate Pharmaceuticals India Ltd*, has achieved over **â‚¹100 crore** revenue within three years of launch.
- It aims to reach **â‚¹250 crore** by *FY 2025â€“26*, with growth driven by an expanding product range and retail coverage.
- The company plans to diversify into new therapeutic categories, expand facilities, adopt digital channels, and explore *export* opportunities, supported by robust manufacturing standards and international presence.

items.title: Texmaco and RVNL form joint venture for rail modernization
items.summary:
- *Texmaco Rail & Engineering* and *RVNL* have formed a *joint venture* to enhance *India's rail modernization*.
- The venture will produce *freight and passenger rolling stock*, including *wagons, locomotives, coaches*, and undertake *EPC projects*.
- It aims to promote *automation, AI, and green tech*, supporting *Make in India* and *self-reliance* efforts, while expanding *global competitiveness* of Indian railways.
